website_summaries.verdict: A maintenance-free motorcycle battery that is sure to serve you well for years to come.
pros: Holds a charge three times longer than traditional motorcycle batteries
No need to ever add water to the battery
cons: Battery fit sometimes is very tight

customer_reviews.title: Stay away!  Manufacturer will not stand behind if sold on Amazon!  Died after a few months of use
customer_reviews.text: Battery only used a few months and stored indoors. When re-installing, battery would not hold a charge or take a charge. Contacted manufacturer and was told that they do not stand behind the product if sold by Amazon, Ebay or Walmart, because they are not authorized dealers. They would not back the warranty and said that they have many problems with products not being rotated or charged soon enough if bought elsewhere. Luckily, Amazon is amazing and stood behind the product. Save your time, money and headaches and buy a different battery.
customer_reviews.author: SMVfamily

customer_reviews.title: Dead within 6 months
customer_reviews.text: Battery was easy to fill with gel, great instructions and not difficult to do at all. This battery was purchased in October of last year and installed on a 2003 Victory Vegas. Now the battery will only hold enough charge for one start before it is empty. I have attempted to contact Yuasa regarding this matter, and I have not received any response. Please be wary purchasing from them, as they do not seem to be easily contacted and have QC issues.
customer_reviews.author: Kelsey Crockett

customer_reviews.title: You have to put in the electrolyte.
customer_reviews.text: The screen I ordered this battery under listed two P.N.s, the one I always have ordered in the past and one I did not recognize. The difference being the number I have ordered under in the past comes filled and sealed in the box, while the one I received here had to have the electrolyte put in the battery. It really is no big deal and the electrolyte comes in a plastic tube assembly that made filling easy. The tube assemble slides into the holes on top of the battery, press firmly down to break the seal and let drain. Remove the tubes, add the sealant strip and you are done.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cook

customer_reviews.title: Defective, won’t take a charge
customer_reviews.text: I needed to replace an original ELEVEN YEAR OLD ATV Yuasa battery in my 2008 Yamaha ATV. This is an exact replacement for the current Yuasa battery. I figured the last one went 11 years so why try any other brand. Disappointed that this replacement won’t even take a charge... I added the acid and charged per the instructions but the battery won’t hold a charge for even a day. These batteries are not returnable because they are “hazardous material” once filled. But Amazon came through and issued a full refund.
customer_reviews.author: B. Phelps

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong after 13 months
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in March 2016. Installed in a Kawasaki Jet Ski. Always kept charged using a Deltran battery tender. Died after 8 months. I am now on-line shopping for a replacement. Obviously I will not be purchasing this battery again as 8 months life is not acceptable. Updated May 2017 - my apologies for my initial review. After doing additional troubleshooting I found out my problem was the starter relay, not the Yuasa battery. Fixed the problem with the relay, charged the battery and now everything works as it should.
customer_reviews.author: James Hodges

customer_reviews.title: Great Battery
customer_reviews.text: Installed in a 2003 Honda Goldwing trike. It's the exact battery that was in it for 10 years. Why change brands when it's as good as you can get. The instructions where very simple. The process you go through to add the acid was very easy, very clean, and very well thought out. No mess, no spills. Yes, I will definitely recommend this battery to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: toyfarm

customer_reviews.title: Exact SeaDoo Jetski Replacement Battery
customer_reviews.text: Exact replacement for my 2016 SeaDoo GTI 155. Acid comes seperately in the packaging but it's super easy to put in. Just firmly click the container into place and it drains it perfectly for you. MAKE SURE TO INSPECT THE BATTERY FOR DAMAGE BEFORE PUTTING IN THE ACID. I'm giving it 4 stars instead of 5 because my first battery came damaged. They did not package it properly at all and I did not inspect it so it started leaking acid. So I had to call Amazon and they sent a free replacement. This battery is $130 at the dealer compared to the price here which is about half. Highly reccomend!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Fernandez

customer_reviews.title: Great battery
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my 2nd battery I have had on my motorcycle. The first on came on a new 2002 Honda vtx 1800. It lasted 9 years so I replaced it with the same battery and it lasted 9 years. The old battery still hold a charge and is usable. This is the only battery I will ever by for my motorcycle. Installation is not simple but that's a Honda issue. I never take the battery out for winter storage. It stays in a detached garage with no heat on a trickle charger. It starts my bike up every spring with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Roy A. Leon

customer_reviews.title: Recommended by SeaDoo
customer_reviews.text: Bombardier recommends this battery, also it was made in Pennsylvania and not in Asia. Costs a bit more but if you want to support an American manufacturer, get this one. Too bad they can't match the price of the imports. Keep in mind you have to add the electrolytic fluid to the battery before installing it, while most others come charged and ready to install. It wasn't difficult to do, just be aware of this extra step. Price and this step were why I only gave 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Preston

customer_reviews.title: OEM battery for yamaha, the best one.
customer_reviews.text: same as OEM for yamaha. also, this comes with acid separate, so this can sit in the box until you are ready for it- when you put the acid in you have a brand new battery. other pre filled batteries are deteriorating even before they are shipped to you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great batteries and great customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these batteries 1 worked great and the other one only held a charge for 2 days was very disappointed contacted the seller and was very surprised with how fast they contacted me back to resolve this issue great customer service also very good batteries cant beat the price I dont use anything else for my atvs u wont go wrong with these batteries or customer service
customer_reviews.author: jacob andrew

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: The battery arrived a day early and was well packed. Filling the electrolyte was very easy and went off without a hitch. After letting the glass mats fully absorb the fluid and a full charge, installation was straightforward. My bike started right up. Since I just installed it, I can't comment on the longevity yet, but I did install one in my Honda and it lasted several years.
customer_reviews.author: Bassaholic

customer_reviews.title: Yuasa batteries are the best in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my snowmobile. I've tried other batteries from Advance Auto and Auto Zone and they only last a couple of years. Yuasa batteries are the best in my opinion. I got 8 years out of the original one in my Honda Goldwing and it was still working. I only changed it because I didn't want to take a chance on it dying somewhere. I won't buy another brand battery for any of my toys!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Mark Gandulla

customer_reviews.title: Awesome. Fits for 850 CanAm outlander 2016
customer_reviews.text: Well what can I say.....? This battery is perfect and is the exact same as the on on my 2016 CanAm 850 xt outlander. Only thing I would say is when you put the electrolyte in the battery do not put the cap on tightly I until it's fully charged and before you start charging it for the first time make sure you leave the electrolyte in the battery for 30-50 min. I would recommend to buying one of the small battery tender 3Amp
customer_reviews.author: elgreco

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing battery
customer_reviews.text: I had this exact same battery on my ATV for 8 years and it was still perfect. I bought this one as preventative maintenance only with winter approaching. Also, it shipped for free and I received it in two days. I couldn't believe it. Great service and a great product. I've never had to add acid to a battery before but it was really easy to do and the instructions were perfect. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Doig

customer_reviews.title: Click...click...click..BROOOOM!
customer_reviews.text: "Everlast" from Wal-Mart didn't even last a year, even though the trickle charger was " green". Bike wouldn't start. The bike wouldn't start even with jumper cables. Since the light was green on the charger I thought my starter was bad. I read that if there was a bad cell in the battery that jumping it wouldn't work. Since I was almost convinced it was the starter I reluctantly purchased this battery. Boy am I gladci did. I dropped it into my 2001HDcHeritage Classic and it cranked right up. OUTSTANDING!
customer_reviews.author: MJS

customer_reviews.title: Replacment for Harley.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put acid pack into battery. Battery was the correct size and fit tray perfectly. Charged up at rate/time instructed. Battery starts my bike every time I ride. We will see about durability over the winter starts. Good price on Amazon and a great purchase. Shipping is cheap and fast with Prime.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Needs acid installed.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't realizing the battery required the acid added by the user. It looked identical to the one that came with the jetski. Also the female receivers for the cables were not specific for the jetski like the one delivered with the jetski. I would not have purchased had I known.
customer_reviews.author: W. L. S.

customer_reviews.title: OEM Replacement For Honda VTX 1800c
customer_reviews.text: Be aware you have to fill the battery yourself but the tubes fit on neatly and are easy to use. I didn't have any issues with spills. The battery is the same as the OEM in my VTX, so that gave me good peace of mind. The battery was an exact fit, of course. And it worked perfectly well since installation.
customer_reviews.author: mikeheel

customer_reviews.title: It comes with the fluid to fill
customer_reviews.text: So when its full, you have a new battery on the date you fill it. Then charge on a slow charger that stops charging when at correct voltage. Every thing you need is in box, including bolts to clamp your terminals to.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had purchased a CHROME battery earlier, trying to save a few bucks. What a waste of money. I purchased this YUASA battery and BAM! My GL1800 started right up. Never going with another brand for my GOLDWING. This should last me a 5 or 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: James Munn

customer_reviews.title: Was never quite strong enough
customer_reviews.text: I had this battery in my Yamaha Roadstar 1700 for several of years. I only ride few times per year, and battery is kept on trickle charger when bike is stored. This battery never had great power, and wouldn't hold a charge very long.
customer_reviews.author: JDW

customer_reviews.title: Very poor delivery, good fit
customer_reviews.text: Unbelievably poor delivery. Date was changed three times and ended up taking 25 days almost a month. Was promised a $10 credit for poor delivery and that didn’t happen. Just put in today fits a Yamaha Wolverine just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D.

customer_reviews.title: Best ATV battery out there
customer_reviews.text: These are the only brand of ATV battery I will use. They last a long time. In fact this same brand battery was on our 2008 kawasaki brute force 750 that finally needed replacement in 2018. 10 years!!
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for current battery
customer_reviews.text: This battery was ordered because it’s the same as the ones that I currently had in my Honda 1800 VTX motorcycle. We chose the same brand because the other one lasted forever and have never gotten stuck because of a battery issue
customer_reviews.author: CathyG

customer_reviews.title: Best Price
customer_reviews.text: Best price I could find - Honda dealer wanted to charge me ridiculous price. Using in my 2008 Honda Goldwing. Have been using this brand battery in my motorcycles for many years. I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: jimfrompa

customer_reviews.title: This is the OEM 2008 Honda GL1800 Gold Wing Battery
customer_reviews.text: I got 7 years out of the last one, I think I will get another 7 years out of this one, too! I like that they are dry-shipped and you activate them when you are ready for install. You are assured of a fresh battery that way...
customer_reviews.author: DaveFromDenver

customer_reviews.title: Yuasa battery
customer_reviews.text: Yuasa is great battery. It was supposed to take about a week to receive the battery. I upgraded shipping, which was supposed to cut the shipping time in half. I got it the next day. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Damon H

customer_reviews.title: Another great battery bought on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: I have bought several batteries on Amazon and everyone of them I have been impressed with, and this is another one of them. After I poured the acid in, it was already charged to 12.4 volts according to my tester. The instructions ask for you to charge the battery on a slow trickle charge for around 8 hours or so. I don't even have to do that!
customer_reviews.author: Navy Boy

customer_reviews.title: maintenance free is the best. be sure to charge on low settings
customer_reviews.text: Yusa is a top rated battery maker. it is the battery of choice among motorsport professionals including jet skis, snow skis, motorcycles. maintenance free is the best. be sure to charge on low settings. a 10 amp charge will render the battery nearly useless as it won't hold charges well and the life will be seriously shorter. a battery tender is best. but anything with a trickle charge will extend your battery life. whatever you use, it should turn off when charged and on again as the charge diminishes over time.
customer_reviews.author: ME

customer_reviews.title: Dead in a years time.
customer_reviews.text: Great battery if you plan to replace it once per year. I use a battery tender AND start my bike throughout the winter. By spring time, DEAD and would not accept a charge at all. In my opinion, junk.
customer_reviews.author: Roger G.

customer_reviews.title: Fits Triumph Rocket III
customer_reviews.text: This fit my Triumph Rocket III perfectly. It is shipped with the sulfuric acid in a separate container. Read the directions FIRST. Make sure you follow the directions as the seal is punctured by the battery as you install the acid. Do it correctly and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: barbara patton

customer_reviews.title: Best batt for PWC
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be best battery I have found for PWCs left at dock for weeks during the summer without running. Never seem to lose charge. Store on a tender over the winter and they read 12.6 in May. Replaced all marine batteries with these.
customer_reviews.author: TS

customer_reviews.title: Adding the electrolyte is very easy.  Wear gloves while doing this "just in case".
customer_reviews.text: The batteries come with all the screws and washers needed for more than one type of motorcycle. The physical parts of the job are simple, but you need to allow time for the electrolyte to be absolved by the plates for at least 30 minutes after filling. You can then charge the battery for whatever time it takes to fully charge. The caps should be left off until the battery is fully charged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Has the crank!
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the battery in my 2005 Grizzly 660, and resolved the starting issue. Engine has strong compression and needs a battery that holds it’s cranking power. This battery has it!
customer_reviews.author: Barry Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: Great Product, diredt replacement
customer_reviews.text: Battery shipped with acid tubes that are a breeze to load, no mess or spilling. Battery well packed and hardware for cables included, good quality fittings. Put on battery tender overnight and battery instantly started bike, 1300 v-star, the next morning. Yuasa was OEM for this bike, 2009 model and is the first replacement battery I have bought for it. Seems like a good idea to stick with OEM products.
customer_reviews.author: W. Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Works for my Fatbob
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my Harley fatbob. Didn't expect the whole build it yourself thing, but the instructions were easy to follow and didn't take more than 10min.
customer_reviews.author: Robby

customer_reviews.title: fast shipped
customer_reviews.text: battery works but the fitment for my bike is very tight fit so i needed to modify my battery box just a bit to make it fit correctly (2008 harley super glide)
customer_reviews.author: trkdrvrman

customer_reviews.title: If it was 2 mm all around smaller it would be a perfect fit. Easy fill
customer_reviews.text: Fit my 2011 Street Bob. It's a tiiight fit in the holder on bike though. If it was 2 mm all around smaller it would be a perfect fit. Easy fill, charged fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Got in February. Charged properly. It is now on the Charger for the 3rd time. Note other reviews! If it dies again, I will be following up with Seller/Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Jason Reed

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Junk battery! It lasted for 3 weeks in my Grizzly 450 that does not see hard use at all. It shorted out inside the battery. I’ve learned a lesson to only buy batteries from local businesses.
customer_reviews.author: weeweewarrior

customer_reviews.title: Fitment is wrong!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Does NOT fit 07 grizzly 350 4x4 Yamaha. Dont believe fitment!!! Luckily have a 06 grizzly 450 4x4 with a 14 yr. old battery that did fit.
customer_reviews.author: KK

customer_reviews.title: Only lasted 1 month
customer_reviews.text: This battery lasted 1 month, we thought something more serious was wrong with our 2012 Can am 4 wheeler, so we took it to the shop, it was the new battery. It's not like you can ship back a used battery. Money completely wasted
customer_reviews.author: Erin Baker

customer_reviews.title: Would not hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: After following the instructions I installed battery. It seemed to work ok but would not hold charge. I know the Yusa battery is the best but had to ask for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Marty R.

customer_reviews.title: Barely fits a Harley
customer_reviews.text: I literally came right back in the house after trying to put this on my Harley Davidson 2008 FXD. It is a very tight fit in the cradle (tigher than you want). Its not worth the savings for the headache. Not too mention, like any shipped battery, you have to add the acid and then charge it. Not plug and play. Highly advise buying from a store instead.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome battery and great price
customer_reviews.text: Awesome battery and great price. You will have to put acid in it. It comes with it and didn't spill a drop. Easy foolproof system. You will have to charge for 8 to 12 hours. Best price for sure. Even if you go to local store you will save 30 buck's
customer_reviews.author: true rating

customer_reviews.title: No issues yet.
customer_reviews.text: This battery was exactly the same as the previous Interstate Battery I had in my Harley. Only difference was label. I also started using a battery tender. Used one on my Ultra and it was a battery saver.
customer_reviews.author: Wfillbra

customer_reviews.title: Try Amazon - they have everything
customer_reviews.text: I told my husband - Try Amazon, they may have it.” And they did. My husband happy with price, product and delivery
customer_reviews.author: Donnancmom

customer_reviews.title: Not bad...not great.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this battery exactly 3 Years ago. It’s no longer taking a charge at all. It died on me last summer and after charging it seemed ok. Now it’s dead. 3 Years isn’t bad though. But I might try other brands for a little more money.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect, easy to prepare
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my jet ski. The primary reasons were that it was the same make and model as he battery that came with the jet ski when new and it is made in USA. I was a bit leery of the need to pour in the acid and then seal the battery. No need to worry. The acid comes in a container with simple instructions. It is very easy to do with very easy to follow instructions. If you have concern about spilling the acid, don't be. If you follow the instructions the only place the acid can go is into the battery. And sealing it afterwards is a snap.
customer_reviews.author: P Gleason

customer_reviews.title: Filling the battery was very easy and didn't spill a drop
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2010 700 Grizzly. Filling the battery was very easy and didn't spill a drop. Just be sure to follow the directions. Didn't even need a charge, battery charger showed in at 90% and after my last battery stopped holding a charge this one is working great
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: It’s yet to be seen if this one last as long as the last. But the last one I had lasted 10 years with little to no maint.
customer_reviews.author: Monroe

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit, couldn't return, wasted money
customer_reviews.text: Didn't fit bike, not sure how that happened, I filled in the Make, Model and year It's not returnable; so I gave it to the recycling company to recycle it I bought another one from the local auto parts store, I lost over $70 on the deal
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome batery with MONSTER cranking AMPS!!! Well worth the money to be able to hit the igniotion and fire right up!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 1600 Roadstar bored 30 over with competition cams, pistons, crank, shafts and 13-1 compression. This battery is the only one I could find to turn the beast over. It normally starts on the first stroke. This battery if maintained and took out of the bike in non riding months and left on a trickle charge will last 5+ years!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jake LaGuna

customer_reviews.title: OEM, Factory
customer_reviews.text: OEM , Highly rated...fresh stock. Very fast shipping Returns accepted.
customer_reviews.author: BigJake

customer_reviews.title: Working good
customer_reviews.text: My Goldwing use this battery for OEM. Good Price and Fast shipping and working ok.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Goldwing

customer_reviews.title: Sold Nonrechargeable Battery
customer_reviews.text: The battery would not charge and was defective. I was informed I had to pay the shipping to have it returned since it was outside of the return period. The battery was not installed right when I received it due to putting my bike back together. I was highly disappointed with the response I received from the company and how I am the owner of a bum, nonrechargeable motorcycle battery. Never again. Lucky me!
customer_reviews.author: Kiel Selapack

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Second one died in less than 2 years why does everyone say the last over 6 years ?
customer_reviews.author: KJB

customer_reviews.title: quick delivery
customer_reviews.text: Just installed this, it charged quickly,It arrived sooner than expected
customer_reviews.author: denise

customer_reviews.title: Fast delivery and perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this battery for an older Kawasaki STX jet ski whose battery died. Delivered fast, very easy to add electrolyte, easy instructions. Very satisified.
customer_reviews.author: lesok

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for a 2008 Harley-Davidson Heritage Softail Classic battery.
customer_reviews.text: I like that the battery ships dry and the customer activates it--this way you are sure to have a 100% fresh battery. Just be sure to follow the easy-to-follow instructions exactly. The battery acid container makes filling the battery virtually foolproof. Then you fully charge the battery as instructed (don't exceed the recommended rate!), and then fit the permanent sealing caps. Done!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Sugar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect match
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to add liquid and works and starts vehicle great
customer_reviews.author: johnny b

customer_reviews.title: There's a reason Honda uses these as OEM!
customer_reviews.text: Don't know what they do over there, but my VTX1800N chewed through cheaper batteries like candy. Should've known that Honda picked a winner from the beginning.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Fake or just a dud?
customer_reviews.text: Lasted one season. My last YUASA lasted 8 years. This was either fake or just a dud.
customer_reviews.author: Dean

customer_reviews.title: no hardware no return
customer_reviews.text: I was very upset with this purchase it had no cable mounting hardware, then I find out that there is a no return on this battery
customer_reviews.author: Billy Goyette

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Very simple to add the acid, really foolproof. I was hesitant on getting an "unmixed" battery but there was nothing to it. I have in a HD Softail Deluxe and so far its working good.
customer_reviews.author: WaveMan

customer_reviews.title: Great battery. Exact replacement for Ultra 300X Jetski
customer_reviews.text: Great battery. Exact replacement for Ultra 300X Jetski. No complaints. Will order again if need new battery in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy C.

customer_reviews.title: OEM name & number
customer_reviews.text: Hope to get back to several yrs before having to change. Last one lasted 5 yrs. (This Brand) the one that replaced it from local auto store 1 yr.
customer_reviews.author: M. Seibel

customer_reviews.title: First time odering battery on line
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance ordering this motorcycle battery on line instead of from a dealership. I was initially pleased with the price difference, but it didn't end there. The battery arrived quickly and the instructions for adding the fluids were easy to follow and worked like a charm. You do need to have a battery charger to complete the process before installation.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Frost

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: 2nd one I bought for my motorcycle in 10 years. I will never buy a different brand. Always starts. I live in the desert where it’s 110+ for more than 3 months a year. Very great deal.
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: No charge battery
customer_reviews.text: Battery want hold a charge, have less than 4000 miles on it. Would not purchase this brand again, I’m stuck with it since company want take back and amazon want after 30 days.
customer_reviews.author: michael nickels

customer_reviews.title: Reliability and longevity.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for the exact same battery that came in my 2006 Goldwing motorcycle. That battery lasted eight years and still had 25% of life left in it. Reliability and longevity. It is hard to get a better recommendation than that!
customer_reviews.author: Konrad Poth

customer_reviews.title: Perfect OEM fit plenty of power
customer_reviews.text: Great product works well. Perfect OEM fit and plenty of power to start and run all the accessories on my four-wheeler. Highly recommended to replace your battery on your Yamaha Big Bear 4x4.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Lombardozzi

customer_reviews.title: Good price fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: I've had for couples months now. Good price fast shipping,starts my bike well.we will see how long it lasts. Shooting for more than 2 yrs. That seems to be the norm with other batteries for me. If less I'll drop rating. Let you know.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Skare Jr.

customer_reviews.title: fit our 2012 honda goldwing trike
customer_reviews.text: great price, cheaper than the local dealer.. same battery as factory installed
customer_reviews.author: mary burnette

customer_reviews.title: Ordered this battery and received it 2 days later . You can't ask for better service.
customer_reviews.text: I like this battery it is exactly like I ordered . I followed the directions and my atv started right up without any problems.and the price is awesome for this quality of a battery.
customer_reviews.author: LINDA MADRON

customer_reviews.title: Perfect  battery
customer_reviews.text: Battery was shipped with acid in seperate container. Very easy to dispense. By putting the acid into the battery when i need to use it, makes me get maximum life out ot the battery when compared to other batteries sitting on store shelves deteriorating with the acid already in it.
customer_reviews.author: khancoon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, been buying these for my ATV's and ...
customer_reviews.text: Item is as described. Delivered on time. Excellent product, been buying these for my ATV's and always a top notch product that lasts several years! Very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Exact fit, short life span.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a replacement for my 2010 Kymco UXV500. It was a exact replacement for the original, but only lasted 13 months.
customer_reviews.author: War Gamer....

customer_reviews.title: Fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Fast shipping exactly what I wanted. Fits perfectly. Great price.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Battery was dead and unchargable out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box, added acid per instructions and installed on the bike. Put a trickle charger on overnight to bring charge up as I've done numerous times. After charge, battery only showed 8 Volts and unchangeable.
customer_reviews.author: flip

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this battery for my 2005 Yamaha RS warrior but it was too damn big although Amazon said it would fit. Now im stuck with a battery I can't even return!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Battery not “ready to go”.
customer_reviews.text: Contrary to product description, battery wasn’t “ready to go “. Battery was shipped dry with fluid (acid) packaged separately. Although adding fluid was straightforward, handling acid is undesirable.
customer_reviews.author: Redd

customer_reviews.title: I replaced it with a mighty Max battery half the price
customer_reviews.text: Battery did not last 12 months. I replaced it with a mighty Max battery half the price
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great item
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd of this battery I have purchased, the first one lasted 6 years. in my Harley. I fill the battery and charge it for 24 hours before use. I am expecting another 6 years from this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt fit 2004 honda rincon probably my mistake
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my rincon 04 650. terminals are opposite had to put battery in backwards probably my mistake when i ordered
customer_reviews.author: Jerad A.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: It is what it seys it is. You do have to add the liquid too it. But it's is easy to do. If needed I will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: chris romero

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Exact replacement, followed the instructions and jet ski fired right up time and time again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: $80, but my old one lasted eight and a half years!
customer_reviews.text: This replaces my battery from my 2008 Yamaha Wolverine 450 4 X4 quad, where the battery lasted an amazing eight and a half years since the date on it. However it did say made in USA. I'm keeping my fingers crossed for this one.
customer_reviews.author: kurt

customer_reviews.title: 2008 can am outlander w/snow plow
customer_reviews.text: Faster delivery than PRIME shipping! Just got the battery, February 3rd. Delivery was estimated to be delivered Thursday, February 5, 2015 - Tuesday, February 10, 2015. Filled the battery, and charging it now. It's the exact same battery, and the OEM has lasted 7 years with a snow plow. I hope this one serves me as well as the OEM !!!!
customer_reviews.author: DPWhite

customer_reviews.title: Best Brand
customer_reviews.text: Yuasa Batteries have held up by far the best in my 50+ years of motorcycle and atv riding.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: The posting did not say there was assembly required. However the directions that came with the battery were simple and easy to follow. Once a few steps were taken, the battery was charged, it worked great! I’m riding again! 👍🏍
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great battery for the price and exact fit for the old one I removed from my bike.
customer_reviews.text: Just like the old one and at a super price compared to other sites I looked at for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: MN GQ

customer_reviews.title: Item arrived inoperable.
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived and there was a crack in the bottom of battery. I did not notice until acid started leaking out when filling up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best Value By Far
customer_reviews.text: I use these batteries all the time and I am quite impressed with their overall quality. I have purchased other brands/types in the past and ended up being disappointed. I researched and compared this battery w/many others out there on the market (including gel ones which I've tried) and have discovered that this battery wins every comparison hands down...and it's less expensive by far.
customer_reviews.author: Hyonnahill

customer_reviews.title: Dependable
customer_reviews.text: I have alsways used Yuasa batteries in my bikes. My last one stoped holding a charge after 4 years which I have found to be the average for these batteries. So I bought a new one to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with my 07 Yamaha Grizzly 700
customer_reviews.text: Worked great with my 07 Yamaha Grizzly 700. My only recommendation is to put the battery on a trickle charger for a couple hours before putting it in the vehicle
customer_reviews.author: nicholas karahalios

customer_reviews.title: Works great had to pour the fluid into the battery just put gloves on an protect your eyes. Battery voltage is holding up.
customer_reviews.text: Replaced my battery on my 2015 Sea-Doo spark 2 up 60 hp.
customer_reviews.author: jesus ramos

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I got 11 years or 100K miles on my first one. So I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Dave S.

customer_reviews.title: Pricey, but peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: Yuasa batteries are rather pricey compared to the local farm and fleet store. But, they last a long time, you don't need to add water every spring, and are fool proof. If you are halfway handy, you will have no trouble adding the acid to initiate the battery. Seal it up, charge and you're good to go. These batteries have given me peace of mind in my motorcycle travels.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. B

product_meta.title: Yuasa YUAM320BS YTX20L-BS Battery
product_meta.description: Style:BatterySpecial thin separators - allow two extra plates per cell to be installed, for 30% improvement in cranking performance. Engineered to protect against corrosion, withstand vibration, and deliver high cranking power.
feature_bullets: 12 Volt, 18 amp-hour, 270 cold cranking amps, maintenance-free battery
Totally sealed and spill-proof - all acid is absorbed in special plates and absorbed glass mat separators
No need to ever add water
Advanced lead-calcium technology hold its specific gravity more than 3 times longer than conventional batteries
Battery supplied dry with acid bottle
